intro: Deiregyne pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramidal daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its upright, pyramidal shape and is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer, surrounded by pale green bracts. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Deiregyne pyramidalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
